recipeData.name: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
recipeData.description: A potent growth enhancer made from the fermented sap of fast-growing plants. Rich in enzymes and microorganisms.
ingredients: 1kg of fast-growing plant parts (e.g., sweet potato tips, bamboo shoots)
steps: Collect plant material before sunrise when most potent. Do not wash.
Add an equal weight of brown sugar and mix well.
Pack tightly into a breathable container, filling to about 2/3 capacity.
Cover with a cloth, store in a cool, dark place for approx. 7 days.
recipeData.usage: Dilution rate: 1:500 to 1:1000 with water. Applied as foliar spray or soil drench.

recipeData.name: Fish Amino Acid (FAA)
recipeData.description: A nitrogen-rich fertilizer made from fermented fish parts, excellent for vegetative growth.
steps: Chop the fish parts into small pieces.
Layer the fish parts and brown sugar in a container (2/3 full).
Cover and let ferment for at least 3-6 months in a cool, dark place.
recipeData.usage: Dilution rate: 1:1000 with water. Primarily used as a soil drench.
